Set the oven to preheat at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Beat the butter and vanilla in a medium bowl using an electric mixer until creamy, about 2 to 3 minutes.
Form the dough into small balls, about 1 inch in diameter, and place them on a baking sheet.
Take small portions of dough and roll them between your palms into 1-inch spheres. Arrange the balls 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven until the edges are just beginning to turn golden, approximately 12 minutes.
Take the cookies out of the oven and move them to a wire rack to cool for 15 minutes.
Put the leftover 1/3 cup of powdered sugar in a small bowl. Roll the cooled cookies in the powdered sugar once or twice.
